events.name: Null Singapore Aug Meetup: News Bytes , Deep Dark Web &  Bitcoin
events.description:
**null meets are free for anyone to attend. There are absolutely no fees. Just come with an open mind and willingness to share and learn** Agenda:  Introduction & Networking : 15 mins News Bytes by  Randen: 15 mins Each Talks : 45 Mins  Red Riding Hood in the Deep Dark Woods by Fadli Bitcoin and its role in ensuring Privacy by Dias  Map: Please see the meetup map or follow below street view map. https://www.google.com/maps/@1.280919,103.847042,3a,75y,317.56h,95.79t/data=!3m4!1e1!3m2!1sVb_jjHjK7OEtOoaHIfwSpQ!2e0?hl=en  Streetdirectory: http://www.streetdirectory.com/sg/car-park-amoy-street-a0006/30317_1.html Landmark: Its opposite to Car Park Via MRT:  ThoughtWorks(TW) office is 3 mins away from Telok Ayer MRT (DT, purple line) . TW office is 7 mins walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT (green line), take Exit G and take a left till you reach a right turning road and look for 87 B.  Abstract of the talk(s) given by respective speakers  News Bytes: It will cover the latest news on information security that were in headlines in last month.  Red Riding Hood in the Deep Dark Woods We have all heard about the Deep and Dark Web but how many of us have actually explore it and how many of us are already inside it yet we do not realize it? From selling of personal data to credit card data, these are just a glimpse of what is happening in the dark net. This talk aims to share some of the 'interesting' things found during my exploration in the deep web and why the deep dark web is an interesting and at the same time a very dangerous place to be. 


Bitcoin and its role in ensuring Privacy Bitcoin is pseudo anonymous crypto currency, this talk will briefly discuss Bitcoins for the uninitiated and then move onto interesting applications for decentralization and privacy, such as its application in Data Storage, Networks etc.  Speaker(s) Bio: 



Fadli is a cyber security enthusiast who loves to read all things security. Currently working at Silverskin Technologies, Fadli is a bookworm who loves to read, blog and a sucker for security conferences. He has written various security articles and has spoken in conferences worldwide. Dias is an Engineer working with Quantified Assets in Singapore and works on giving digital life to asset classes that are believed to be dead. He has been messing around with stuff since he was a kid and loves challenges. He has had extensive experience with large scale database systems early in his career, and has always been interested in Security. Currently, engaged in debugging and resolving his newborn baby's issues. 



Randen is a software engineer having 12 years of experience in working on both Enterprise/Proprietary and Open Source Technologies. Currently he is more involve in developing API and mobile applications. He had been interested with security and applies it to how he is developing his applications. 



Follow us on twitter @nullsingapore and fb at facebook.com/nullsingapore.
events.location: Thought Works,  Level 3, 87B Amoy Street, 069906, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: JS Beginner Study Group
events.description: Following on from the last session, most people have indicated that they would like to work on their own projects, with the guidance of mentor(s). We will try to implement this in our future sessions. This week, we will carry on with "You Don't Know JS"  and after the discussion, we can start working on our own practical projects.  Confirmed mentor(s): Melvin Location is now confirmed at Hackerspace! **Please bring your laptops and try to read up on the following material: Scope & Closures - http://bit.ly/1PeOFoc Please try to read Chapter 1 & 2 for the discussion. **Join our chat channel: #milo-dinosaur on Kopi.JS Slack - http://kopijs.herokuapp.com/
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: Dinner, chill out and chat
events.description: Let's meet for dinner, chill out, and chat! A great opportunity to meet like-minded game developers and share ideas.
events.location: Xin Wang Hong Kong Cafe, Plaza Singapura, #06-08/09/10, Singapore
